full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 44 of 236 LC3Cmax1 Alessi - cross 1 Q. So when you went into Mr. Epstein's house twice in 2003 and stole at least $6,300, you owned properties valued at over a million dollars; correct? 2 A. I don't think it's correct. 3 Q. Well -- 4 A. Because I sold the properties at Tower 1515 in order to buy 5 the property for the multifamily. 6 Q. Let's look the 3504-022, going to be deposition page 145. 7 Let's start at line 19. 8 Do you have that in front of you, Mr. Alessi? 9 A. I cannot read. 10 Q. 3500, page 17. 11 A. I cannot read it. 12 THE COURT: They'll make it bigger in a moment. 13 I'm sorry. Can you give me the cite again? 14 MR. PAGLIUCA: It's 3504-022, page 17 of 35, 15 deposition page 145, line 19. 16 Q. Do you have that, Mr. Alessi? 17 A. Yes. 18 Q. You were asked the question: 19 "Q. Now, do you recall in December of 1997, you and your wife 20 bought an apartment at 1902 115 South Flagler Drive; right?" 21 A. Yes. 22 "Q. Purchase price was $105,000?" 23 You answered: 24 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012558
